str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To minister to, serve. From huperetes; to be a subordinate, i.e. subserve.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Counsel, deliberate wisdom, decree. From boulomai; volition, i.e. advice, or purpose.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To place (put) to, add; I do again. From pros and tithemi; to place additionally, i.e. Lay beside, annex, repeat.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Destruction, decay, corruption. From diaphtheiro; decay.
